name: Age Range Compatibility Equation
description: Everybody knows the classic ["half your age plus seven"](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Age_disparity_in_sexual_relationships#%22Half-your-age-plus-seven%22_rule) dating rule that a lot of people follow (including myself). It's the 'recommended' age range in which to date someone. * `$\text{Min} = \dfrac{ \text{Age} } {2} + 7$` * `$\text{Max} = 2 \cdot (\text{Age - 7})$` * `$\text{Minimum age} \le \text{Your age} \le \text{Maximum age}$` ## Task Given an integer (1 <= n <= 100) representing a person's age, return their minimum and maximum age range. This equation doesn't work when the age <= 14, so if the age <= 14, use this equation instead: ``` min = age - 0.10 * age max = age + 0.10 * age ``` You should floor all your answers so that an integer is given instead of a float (which doesn't represent age). Return your answer in the form ```"[min]-[max]"``` ## Examples: ``` age = 27 => "20-40" age = 5 => "4-5" age = 17 => "15-20" ```
